intro: Miconia meridensis, commonly known as the mountain miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high elevations. It is known for its ability to thrive in cool, moist climates and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
